required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Everolimus in de Novo Heart Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Early vs. Delayed EVERolimus in de Novo HEART Transplant Recipients: Optimization of the Safety/Efficacy Profile (EVERHEART Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study, in de novo heart transplant patients, is to evaluate whether delayed introduction of everolimus reduces the occurrence of wound healing problems, pericardial and/or pleural effusion and early acute renal insufficiency, as compared with immediate introduction of everolimus, in the firs six months after heart transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With at Least One Occurrence of Safety Composite Endpoint After 6 Months by Treatment Group
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of 6-month cumulative incidence of safety composite endpoint (wound healing delay) related to initial transplant surgery, pleural/pericardial effusions and occurrence of acute renal insufficiency, defined as estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) ≤ 30 mL/min/1.73 m2, between delayed everolimus arm and immediate everolimus arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Partcipants With at Least One Occurrence of Each Safety Composite Endpoint Event After 6 Months by Treatment Group
Hazard Cox's Model Analysis of Pericardial/Pleural Effusions
secondary_outcome.description: Pericardial effusions: any pericardial effusion defined as at least moderate (i.e. measuring at least 2.0 cm in diastole, in the point of largest distance between the pericardial leaflets), with or without signs of hemodynamic compromise, or leading to drainage or to prolonged hospitalization. Pleural effusions: need for surgical drainage tubes for longer than 7 days after surgery and subsequent pleural effusions leading to drainage. CI = confidence interval, HR = hazard ratio, MDRD = Modification of Diet in Renal Disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute and Percent Frequencies of Patients With LDL ≥ 100 mg/mL at 1, 3 and 6 Months, by Treatment Group
Participants With CMV Infection and CMV Syndrome/Disease After 6 Months by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: CMV infection is defined as pp65 antigenemia or DNAemia

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With at Least One Occurrence of Composite Treatment Failure Events
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of 6-months cumulative incidence of composite treatment failure events (BPAR ≥ 2R, rejection with hemodynamic compromise, graft loss, or death) between delayed everolimus arm and immediate everolimus arm

group.title: Immediate Introduction of Everolimus
group.description: Everolimus within 144 hours (5 days) after graft reperfusion + cyclosporine microemulsion + steroids

group.title: Delayed Introduction of Everolimus
group.description: Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) within 144 hours (5 days) after graft reperfusion + cyclosporine microemulsion + steroids. After 4 to 6 weeks since transplant, everolimus in place of MMF and dose of cyclosporine reduced.

group.title: Immediate Introduction of Everolimus
group.description: Everolimus within 144 hours (5 days) after graft reperfusion + cyclosporine microemulsion + steroids

group.title: Delayed Introduction of Everolimus
group.description: Mycophenolate mofetil (MMF) within 144 hours (5 days) after graft reperfusion + cyclosporine microemulsion + steroids. After 4 to 6 weeks since transplant, everolimus in place of MMF and dose of cyclosporine reduced.

measure.title: Calculated BMI
measure.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) Body mass divided by the square of their height.

CI = confidence interval, HR = hazard ratio, MDRD = Modification of Diet in Renal Disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: CSF white blood cell count increased

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
